front.text: Each verse is divided into several cards. This makes them easier to learn. Cards can be flipped and swiped.

back.text: Swipe left or right to move to the next card.

front.text: In the “inbox” are the cards of the verses that you are learning. It may take you a few days to learn the card well.

back.text: When you have memorized a card, swipe it up.

front.text: In the inbox for each verse there are two cards: the text and the translation, and on the reverse side there is a word-for-word translation.

back.text: You can add multiple verses and learn them at the same time.

front.text: Memorized cards fall into the “Overview” deck for long-term fixation in memory.

back.text: A system of spaced repetitions is used for that.

front.text: Each verse in this deck is divided into several cards with a question on one side and an answer on the other.

back.text: The answer is on this side of the card. Now you can evaluate how well you answered and rate yourself.

front.text: If you answered “Good” or “Excellent”, then the intervals between repetitions increase, otherwise they decrease.

back.text: You will repeat only those cards that you do not remember well. And cards that you know well - repeat less often.
